headline: France, Loath to Repatriate Jihadists, Ends Up Putting Ghosts on Trial
abstract: With public opinion firmly against allowing the return of those who left to fight in Syria and Iraq, the French justice system finds itself facing the strange concept of the “ghost trial.”
lead_paragraph: PARIS — The trial this month was exceptional for a country that has resisted repatriating or extraditing terrorism suspects from battlegrounds in Iraq and Syria.
keywords: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
